author: frangio_
content: i think delimiters are the way to go for all sections. this is roughly the syntax i'm going for in my wip assembler. more examples here: https://gist.github.com/frangio/608671a39164eb9372c93012dfd52464

author: frangio_
content: actually not necessarily for data sections, i just remembered i chose not to use delimiters for that

author: frangio_
content: note that code sections in my syntax have an inputs->outputs signature attached. in theory this could be omitted and inferred by the assembler but i think that would be quite complex (may require an smt solver) so it's better to provide it as input to the assembler. the max_stack_height part of the type is easier to infer given inputs and outputs, and you'll get it anyway from doing eof validation which is linear time

content: yeah I'm planning to have annotations like this as well

author: frangio_
content: i'd love to collaborate in some way, though i think our projects may have different goals. my focus is on the minimal set of features i need for a compiler backend, mostly labels, computing the size of sections, and also abstracting some of the differences between legacy and eof targets (the syntax i just shared would be used for both targets). so for example i think i prefer to avoid assembler macros and just deal with code generation in the middle end of the compiler
